result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott E. Waisbrot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Count 1 & 2

Defendant Scott E. Waisbrot in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 16CF30, 16CF220
11:04 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State files Amended Information in 16CF30.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Atty Halverson received a copy of the Amended Information.

Defendant enters a plea of:  16CF30 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Atty Halverson agrees to repeater enhancer. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CF30 Counts 1 & 2 as amended.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
16CF220 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
16CF30 Count 1 - 
Pay fine of $300 plus costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 
Provide DNA sample. 

16CF30 Count 2 - 
Serve 20 days jail. 
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve the entire sentence on Electronic Monitoring program. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 
Provide DNA sample. 
Bond in 16CF220 is to be applied to the fines/costs in 16CF30.
Plea hearing on July 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
filed by the State

Pre-trial conference on May 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.

State files information.

Atty Halverson received a copy, has reviewed this with her client, waives reading and enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.

Court questions Atty Knaapen regarding repeater.

Court accepts the not guilty pleas.

Bond is continued.

Defendant Scott E. Waisbrot in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:15 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Defendant will be waiving his right to a preliminary hearing.
Atty Halverson concurs.

Address is verified.

Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 

Court questions Attorney Halverson.

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.
